thread.title: White House removes 6 staffers after failing FBI checks: report
thread.title_full: White House removes 6 staffers after failing FBI checks: report

author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: White House removes 6 staffers after failing FBI checks: report
text:
Several White House staffers were escorted out by security after failing to pass FBI background checks, according to a report. (JOSHUA ROBERTS/REUTERS) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Thursday, February 16, 2017, 7:27 PM 
Several White House staffers were removed from the administration Thursday morning after failing to go through FBI background checks, according to a report. 
Sources familiar with the matter told Politico that six Trump employees were escorted from the White House by security because they failed to pass the SF86, a Questionnaire for National Security Positions used for security clearances. 
Among those escorted was Caroline Wiles, President Trump's director of scheduling. She's also the daughter of Susan Wiles, Trump's Florida campaign manager and Gov. Rick Scott's (R-Fla.) ex-chief of staff. 
Wiles will reportedly instead work for the Treasury Department, sources told Politico. 
Congress must probe Trump's denials on Russia 
The reported dismissals came during a turbulent week for the Trump administration. 
Embattled ex-national security adviser Michael Flynn was fired Monday night after he admitted he misled senior White House officials, including Vice President Pence, over conversations he had with the Russian ambassador to the U.S. about sanctions imposed by the Obama administration. 
Then-Labor Secretary nominee, fast food CEO Andrew Puzder, withdrew Wednesday after allegations of spousal abuse cost him Republican support. 
The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Tags:
